page.title: 18Education 2: Continued
page.content: Recent Developments ___________________ The number of private schools diminished in the years after the Second World War. This is because during the war many schools were evacuated to avoid bombing. After 1945, as so many schools did not return, buildings and space was either used for residential housing or left to be developed later. These schools are now all charitable trusts, whereas originally they were run for profit. The population of Meads has now become much older and full of retired people. Conseqently, the number of schools has been reduced. There is also one primary school and a college of technology in the area.
